I completely agree! The Crown's ability to balance the personal and the political is one of its strongest aspects. It makes the show feel both intimate and epic at the same time. You get to see the human side of the royal family, with all their flaws and insecurities, while also understanding the weight of their responsibilities and the impact of their decisions on the country and the world.

And yes, the production values are truly exceptional! The attention to detail in every aspect of the show, from the costumes to the sets to the cinematography, is stunning. It's no surprise that the show has won so many awards for its production design, costume design, and cinematography.

The show's creators have said that they aim to make the show feel like a "big, luxurious film" rather than a TV series, and I think they've definitely achieved that. The show's scale and scope are truly cinematic, and it's no wonder that it's been praised for its high production values.

It's also worth noting that the show's creator, Peter Morgan, is a master of weaving together complex historical events with compelling character drama. He's said that he's more interested in the "psychology of power" than in simply recreating historical events, and I think that approach really pays off in the show.
